messages.title: LABOUR CHOOSE FORMER TEACHER TO CHALLENGE KEN
messages.content: David Mellen has been chosen to represent Labour as the Candidate for Rushcliffe at the General Election.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will give the NHS the funding it needs and ensure longer appointments to reduce waiting lists.
Labour proposes more police to keep our communities safe and get rid of zero hour contracts.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A Brexit that protects British jobs
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour aims to negotiate a new EU customs union to ensure citizens living and working here should not be used as bargaining chips for trade.

issues.brexitEurope: Labour aims to negotiate a new EU customs union to ensure citizens living and working here should not be used as bargaining chips for trade.
issues.education: Budget cuts by the Tory Government are impacting Rushcliffe schools, resulting in financial losses and potentially larger class sizes.
issues.health: Labour will give the NHS the funding it needs and ensure longer appointments to reduce waiting lists.

leaflet.personalStatement: David taught at Crossdale Drive Primary School in Keyworth for 12 years before he became a headteacher in Nottingham. He is now a City Councillor as well as a children’s worker for New Life Baptist Church in West Bridgford. David runs a weekly after-school club at Abbey Rd, West Bridgford and volunteers for shopping for the elderly project. David stood for Labour in the 2015 General Election coming second with 14600 votes.

politicalExperience.achievements: Works for New Life Baptist Church in West Bridgford and runs a weekly after-school club. Volunteers for shopping for the elderly project.

contactInformation.address: 70 Melton Rd, West Bridgford, Nottingham, NG2 6EN

images.caption: David Mellen standing in front of Rushcliffe

leaflet.additionalNotes: Encourages recycling of the leaflet with the 'Please recycle' symbol.
